p: MAE has been proposed as a very promising method for natural colourants extraction in different food products, being characterised by a typical two-step diffusion process: an initial extraction from the exterior of the cells, followed by the diffusion of the solute across the membranes [ 32]. MAE has been applied for the recovery of different natural pigments, such as anthocyanins, curcumin, carotenoids, safflower yellow, flavonoids, safflomin A and lycopene, among others [ 33]. Regarding lemon pigment, Chen et al. obtained a highly stable and water-soluble food dye called yellow #15 from the ethanol extract of lemon peels by sonication [ 14]. However, no study has been found reporting MAE for the extraction of yellow pigments from lemon peels.
